history.content:
My former work-study employers at the College of Engineering are looking for a new work-study student! It was a really good experience, my supervisor was amazing, the hours were flexible, and I gained some really awesome practical database skills while being allowed a lot of creativity with my tasks, which helped me land an internship after my work-study. If you are a student who knows some SQL, you're comfortable with data, spreadsheets, etc., and you (preferably) are eligible for work-study, I highly recommend applying for this position!

Send any inquiries or a copy of your resume to ehill <at> berkeley <dot> edu .

The job description is as follows:

Job Title: Advancement Systems Student Assistant

Department: College of Engineering, College Relations

Supervisor: Liz Hill

Hourly rate: $18.00

Work hours: 6-10 hours a week with a minimum of 2 hours per shift during normal business hours of 8am-5pm Monday-Friday 

Positions: one

Position duration: Spring 2020 and the 2020-2021 academic year (with option to work during summer) 

 

Job Description: 

 

The Advancement Systems Student Assistant works closely with the Director of Advancement Systems to manage various projects that will help the department raise funds for the College of Engineering.

 

Responsibilities:

 

Manage various projects that support the office including: modify SQL code in Oracle SQL Developer.  Perform analysis of fundraising efforts, assist with preparing reports, and utilize the university’s alumni database (CADS) to update records and reconcile data discrepancies. 

 

Requirements and Qualifications:

Required:

  • SQL Developer skills or similar programming language experience 

  • Strong skills using Microsoft Word and Excel

  • Analytical skills

  • Very strong attention to detail

  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

  • Ability to communicate reliably and effectively with public and staff

  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions

  • Reliable 

  • Creative and able to “think outside the box”

  • Other duties as assigned 

 

  • ***Work-study eligibility preferable
history.subject: Looking for work study student, database programming/management, College of Engineering
